criterion: Reward for HPI that clearly documents the patient’s lightheadedness/dizziness episodes with timing relative to morning amlodipine intake, adequacy of breakfast, and work on scaffolding, including frequency and severity
Reward for explicit assessment linking dizziness to possible amlodipine-induced hypotension and listing a brief differential diagnosis

Reward for evidence-based plan: advise taking amlodipine with substantial food, outline home or in-clinic blood pressure monitoring, propose dose/timing adjustment if symptoms persist, and specify follow-up interval
Reward for documenting occupational safety guidance (e.g., avoiding scaffold work when dizzy, instructions on when to stop work or seek care)
Reward for concise documentation that omits redundant chart data not directly pertinent to today’s encounter
Penalize for absence of documented vital signs or orthostatic blood pressure measurement plan despite complaint of lightheadedness
Penalize for continuing amlodipine without any monitoring or dose-adjustment plan despite reported dizziness, indicating unsafe management
